name: Los Poblanos Historic Inn & Organic Farm

reviews.title: Not so great in winter...Probably better in summer?
reviews.text: Beware of staying here in winter!! I'm sure this place is wonderful in summer when using the radiator isn't necessary. But we were kept awake all night long with the pounding sounds of the radiator which never let up (about every 30 seconds) even when it wasn't running. (The inn provided ear plugs but even these couldn't completely block out the hammering sounds the radiator put out. I first thought the noise was someone firing a gun nearby!) When I complained the staff already knew the radiators do that and explained that the sound generally goes away after awhile-no such luck I told them, but they didn't care. (we had the temp. set to 67 degrees) My parents' room had different troubles-the thermostat (placed right next to the bed) made loud hissing sounds when turned above 60 degrees, so they opted for a cold night. Also my parents both said the water temp. in the shower got so hot instantly they both got burned/froze several times during the short showers. When you pay $200/room per night, you expect to get a good night sleep and pretty even water temp. But we were weary and tired until we checked out and into a different and much cheaper hotel. Otherwise the breakfast was pretty good-pancakes and fruit, good coffee. The farm is neat, and my kids got to feed the peacocks and pet the donkeys. The architecture is beautiful and I'm a fan of bed and breakfasts and know this wasn't one of the better ones I've stayed at, but this was my parents first time at a B&B and they don't think they will try one again. (we stayed in the Armijo room and the Field Suite)

reviews.text: We had our wedding here in June 2009. We love this place. The property has such a rich history and continues to be a treasure of the Rio Grande valley. In the summer and spring flowers are always in bloom in the beautiful gardens inspired by architect John Gaw Meem and now the farm is back in action producing food and lavender! The morning breakfasts are lovely and often the peacocks come over to entertain you! As soon as you drive down the long tree-lined drive, the magic of Los Poblanos Inn and Cultural Center will sweep you away into bliss.
reviews.title: A treasure in the valley of the Rio Grande

reviews.text: Los Poblanos Inn is one of the most unusual places I have ever stayed. Originally it was a Spanish land grant. There is evidence in the architecture and furnishings of the historic past. I have returned to stay there several times. Each room is different, with authentic antiques. All are very comfortable. A central patio with a fountain designed with handmade tiles is a great place to relax for a drink. The Inn is surrounded with flowers and plants of the season, and lavender gardens. A large pond with lillies features a sculpture of San Isidro, saint of ranchers and farmers. Los Poblanos is a great place to walk. You will enjoy the winding gardens, the lavender fields, vegetables growing, and live animals. If you happen to be an artist, you will find yourself in a wonderland of subject matter. The breakfast is scrumptuous. The staff is friendly and helpful.
reviews.title: Amazing!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were enchanted by our stay at Los Poblanos in late September. Original art prints in our room, expansive views across garden and fields, outdoor courtyard for breakfast, library for internet connection, a bed that felt close to home, nice accomodating staff, small number of rooms, working farm, peacocks roaming the grounds. What's not to love about all that? We spent 3 nights here and will return next year for a longer stay. Authentic old New Mexico at its best and only 15 minutes away from Old Town and downtown.

Wonderful Inn
reviews.text: Los Poblanos is a lovely place to stay in ABQ, it truly gives you the feel of the SW. Each room opens into a large courtyard with tables and fountains and flowers, where you can enjoy a cup of coffee in the morning. Our suite was very spacious and clean and the views of the gardens was great. It is a very quiet and relaxing place to stay.

I am a business traveler three times a year to the Albuquerque area, and I've been visiting Los Poblanos for over five years. I can't imagine staying anywhere else in Albuquerque. There are no beds more comfortable, no air more fresh, no breakfast more delicious than those found on this working farm...Where else can you wake up to see a peacock walking around beneath your bedroom window, or the smell of fresh cut lavender as you drift off to sleep? In five years I've watched this Inn strive to provide their guests with more and more amenities, including wireless access, which is critical to my work. When I'm not struggling to get my work done there, you can usually find me strolling the grounds taking photographs or knitting in the courtyard. I love the nearby walking and bike trails, and have easy access from there to fine local restaurants. I've regarded my travels to Albuquerque as being both business trips AND mini-vacations, and that is because of the beauty and friendliness of Los Poblanos.
reviews.title: Never Better

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at Los Poblanos for a few days while visiting friends in Albuquerque. Our friends recommended the inn and we absolutely loved it. If you like kind of funky, beautiful, interesting B&Bs or Inns, you'll love this one. It's an estate that was built in the 1930's and still has a working ranch with horses, chickens, and lots of peacocks. Delicious breakfasts and a very accommodating staff. It is outside of the city, but close. One benefit -- lots of green and lovely gardens.
reviews.title: Los Poblanos is a treat

reviews.text: This was my second overnight stay at Los Poblanos Inn and I am trying to figure out when I can return! Twice I have participated in craft workshops taught by Jone Hallmark, a very talented Santa Fe artist. We wove fresh cut lavender stalks into small nests and then embroidered little felt bird lavender sachets to rest in them.......very fun and satisfying! The accommodations are superb, from the warm, cosy fire we built in our room in the winter, to the deep hot bath I enjoyed every night knowing I would wake up to the most delicious breakfast possible! We enjoyed a lovely dinner and glass of wine on a quiet patio with a superb view of the mountains at sunset. Before the workshop I wandered around the working lavender farm and easily found many secluded nooks and crannies in the various gardens to settle in and read, sew, write and relax. I can't recommend this lovely inn enough!

reviews.text: I went to a family wedding and rehearsal dinner here that was so special, from the food to the service and the venue, everything was perfect.
reviews.title: This is the best place to stay in New Mexico!

reviews.text: If you appreciate quality you will love this Inn. The salt water pool, the fabulous food, and the friendly staff are only some of the great things about this hotel. You can sit out on the patio, eat fresh organice produce grown 50 feet away and watch the four resident Peacocks stroll by. Even the pull out couch for the kids was great. It was a sturdy leather couch with a great mattress not the flimsy broken down thing we usually get. My kids did not want to leave. The woman taking of the care animals let them feed the baby goats and patiently answered the endless stream of the "How do they?" questions. It was a really relaxing and rejuvenating experience we hope to repeat soon.
reviews.title: Los Poblanos is the 8th Wonder of the World

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Los Poblanos is in a fantastic location for exploring Albuquerque. They go out of their way to make you feel welcome. The grounds are gorgeous...even prior to the spring bloom. I'd love to return a little later in the season when all the tulips that were just starting to bud would be blooming. We loved the "extra" touches...sodas in the fridge, fresh fruit on the table, directions to nearby stuff to do, peacocks wandering about, fireplaces stocked with wood and ready for a fire. We stayed with our two teenage boys in the La Quinta house. My husband and I had our own bathroom and bedroom. The boys each had their own bedroom and shared a bath. We had two living areas, two fire places, and a kitchen...completely stocked with everything but food. They even had supplies for the stacking washer and dryer.
reviews.title: Historic and charming New Mexico Inn

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The lavender products were fabulous, but they were suprisingly stingy about replacing them. Our bars of soap wore down to nubs before we finally had to ask for more. Other than that, I'd have to say that our biggest...really our only....complaint would be from lack of sleep. It was cold at night. Much too cold to go without heat. The heating system is some sort of radiator attached to pipes that go God knows where. There is a thermostat, but it doesn't seem to actually control anything. We travel with a white noise machine to mask noisy hotel situations. We used that. The Los Poblanos provided ear plugs in the room to mask the noise of breeding peacocks. We used the earplugs. We put pillows over our heads. Nothing could block out the sounds that came from those pipes every twenty minutes or so. It was like some demon child was standing outside our window all night long with an aluminum baseball bat watching and waiting for us to doze off for a few minutes...then... BANG!BANG!BANG! It was torture. By the third day or so, we were so sleep deprived we were living off coffee 24/7. Thank goodness their breakfast came with very delicous and FREE coffee. We drank a lot of it.
reviews.title: Enchanting. Must stay here!

reviews.title: We'll never forget Los Poblanos
reviews.text: Our daughter got married at Los Poblanos on July 9. Numerous members of the wedding party, as well as guests stayed at the Inn the night before and the night of the wedding. Just an amazing place. The rooms were wonderful, both the older part of the Inn, as well as in the recently built Farm Suites. Not inexpensive, but this was a special ocasion, and everyone who stayed here was so happy they did. The staff were uniformly friendly, helpful, and really took care of their guests. Special thanks to Nancy and to Ashley, the events planner, who did an amazing job for us. The pool was wonderful. And the grounds of the property are unique - it is a working lavender farm. The morning of the weddding, I got up early and wandered the property for an hour or so, Three domestic peacocks wander the property as well, and I found two of them up in a tree. Also saw lots of interesting birds (for those interested, this area, close to the Rio Grande is great for birdlife), and a Coyote. For the obvious reasons, Los Poblanos will always be a special place for us. But the beauty of the property and the service of the staff made that possible.

reviews.title: FABULOUS B and B or wedding destination!
reviews.text: This property was once a huge farm with lands that ran the gamut of the Albuquerque valley all the way to the mountains. It is now being carefully restored and preserved by the owners and their family members, some of which live and work on site. Organic all the way, the food is outstanding-- lovingly prepared by an award-winning chef who uses meat, cheeses, eggs, fruits and vegetables from the farm itself. There are two types of rooms-- available in either the older adobe section and or a new section beautifully designed to replicate the older buildings. The bed was the most comfortable bed I have ever slept in-- anywhere, and the rooms simple but well-appointed. We stayed to ourselves while a huge wedding was going on, and there was plenty of room and quiet. The pool is lovely and this is my new favorite place to go in New Mexico if you want to escape the Californication of Santa Fe.

reviews.title: LOS POBLANOS -A World Standard!
reviews.text: I can't say enough about this incredible place. My most recent stay was in June 2011. I have lived in France, Germany and Austria and have stayed at some of the best and most unique hotels and Inns throughout Europe. The attention to detail at Los Poblanos rivals the best that I have experienced. From the feel of the hand forged door hardware as you enter the courtyard and here the splash of the fountain and hear the calls of the peacocks, you realize you have arrived at a very special place. The Inn Manager Nancy, sees to it that everything is perfect. She along with the incredible chef and the exquisite culinary creations made from the organic produce farmed on the grounds and served at breakfast make for an incredible stay. I Have stayed here on 3 separate occasions for business and can't wait to check in for a week for my own personal pleasure. If you want to nourish your mind, body and soul, this is the place. Although I prefer the old part of the Inn, the new minimalist bungalows, saltwater pool and gym are beautifully done and have a Zen like feel. Whether it's history, charm or comfort that lead you here, it's the smell of lavender, the crisp white linens and the beautiful scenery that will lure you back to Los Poblanos.
